_comment: Created by hdorning on 23/08/2017 15:41:17 using v2.7
title: How many patients are affected by delayed transfers by the type of care they received?
analysis_commentary:
The trend in the number of delayed transfer of care beds is not the same for acute and non-acute beds. From April 2011 to April 2017, there was a 24% (398 bed) increase in the number of non-acute beds with a delayed transfer of care. The number of beds in acute care who experienced a delayed transfer actually increased by 98% (1,905 beds) in this time period.

Updated July 2017.
